required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Testing the Bioavailability of Phytonutrients, Curcumin and Ursolic Acid
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Clinical Trial Testing the Bioavailability of Phytonutrients, Curcumin and Ursolic Acid

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this research is to investigate the bioavailability of curcumin (CURC) and ursolic acid (UA) in a phase I clinical trial in healthy men and obtain biological material for bioavailability analysis.

detailed_description.textblock: Once a subject is consented and assigned to a cohort, the subject may undergo a digital rectal exam (DRE) and rectal swab fecal collection and provide research blood (including CBC and CMP safety labs) and urine. Medical history data will be collected and reviewed. The PI and/or study staff will provide supplement administration and supplement diary education prior to the subject starting their dose of UA, CURC, or UA and CURC combination. Pharmacokinetic (PK) and pharmacodynamic (PD) assessments will be collected at pre-dose and 6 and 24 hours after the first dose. Urine will also be collected at pre dose and 24 hours post dose. The dosing period will be for a total of 2 weeks (Â± 3 days). On the last day of dosing, subjects will attend a research only visit at which the subject may undergo a digital rectal exam (DRE) and rectal swab fecal collection and provide research blood and urine. At this time, the subject's supplement diary will be reviewed and a safety/AE assessment will be completed. In addition, research CBC and CMP safety labs will be collected. If a subject initially enrolled in Cohort 1 or 2 decides to continue in Cohort 3, the subject will undergo a wash out period of at least 4 weeks and repeat all study procedures for Cohort 3.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Cohort 1 and 2 will receive either UA or CURC and Cohort 3 will receive a combination of UA and CURC. Subjects initially enrolled in Cohorts 1 and 2 may have the option to continue in Cohort 3.

primary_outcome.measure: Number, frequency, duration, and relation of toxicity events
primary_outcome.description: Safety will be compared to evaluate the number, frequency, duration, and relation of toxicity events to CURC and UA, as defined by the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v 4.03.
Dose response curve representing the pharmacokinetic parameter peak serum concentration (Cmax) of ursolic acid, curcumin, and their metabolites will be graphed.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to reach peak serum concentration
primary_outcome.description: The pharmacokinetic parameter, the area under the curve (Tmax) representing the time it takes to reach Cmax of ursolic acid, curcumin, and their metabolites will be graphed.
The pharmacokinetic parameter, half-life of ursolic acid, curcumin, and their metabolites will be graphed.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of bacteria collected from rectal culture sample will be assessed before and after each exposure
Proportions of bacteria collected from rectal culture sample will be assessed before and after each exposure

Metabolite panels will be placed into quartiles and compared to predicted function from the bioinformatics tool Phylogenetic Investigation of Communities by Reconstruction of Unobserved States (PICRUSt) software.

arm_group.description: Administration of Ursolic Acid twice a day for 2 weeks
Administration of Curcumin twice a day for 2 weeks
Administration of Ursolic Acid and Curcumin. If subjects from Cohort 1 or 2 wish to continue in the study, they will undergo a washout period of at least 4 weeks before participating in Cohort 3

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be able to give informed consent
- Be men age 18 or older
- Able to stop supplements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to give informed consent
- Age < 18
- Woman
- Prisoners
- Diagnosed cancer
- Unable to swallow pills
- Unable to stop supplements

overall_official.affiliation: University of Texas Health at San Antonio

facility.name: University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data will be available upon request.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: De-identified data will be available upon request following study completion for approx. 1 year.
